column3: Question
column11: Notes

column3: Third-party DPAs: Resend requires a DPA. Should we use Resend or switch to AWS SES (FedRAMP-authorized)?
column8: Calendly API removed (no DPA needed for link-based scheduling). Resend DPA still needs confirmation, or switch to AWS SES.
column11: Calendly DPA resolved (no API = no DPA). Email provider DPA still open.

column3: Scheduling approach: How should participants book sessions with coaches?
column8: Calendly API integration removed. Each coach's existing Calendly link stored as meetingBookingUrl and displayed behind 'Book Next Session' button. Coaches' existing workflow unchanged. Client confirmed (2026-02-11): 'The original plan MVP was to just take each individual coach's scheduling link and hide it behind a button' — which is exactly what this delivers.
column11: Client confirmed 2026-02-11. Initial miscommunication: client thought we were removing Calendly entirely. Clarified that we removed the API layer only — coach Calendly links are fully supported.

column3: Cloud provider: Which cloud (AWS / Azure / GCP) and region? Affects deployment architecture and data residency.
column11: Longest lead-time item. Everything else depends on this.

column3: Section 508 / WCAG 2.1 AA: Is formal accessibility compliance required? Impacts all phases.
column11: Government contract - likely required but need confirmation.

column3: Deployment model: Do we get access to deploy into client cloud account, or does client team handle deployments? We deliver a Docker image.
column11: Need to know if we push to their container registry or get CI/CD access.

column3: Database provisioning: Who provisions the managed PostgreSQL 16 instance (RDS / Cloud SQL / Azure Database)? What is the approval process and lead time? Min: db.t3.medium (400 max connections).
column11: Database setup has longest lead time after cloud provider decision.

column3: Container orchestration: Does the client already run containers? ECS Fargate / Cloud Run / Azure Container Apps / Kubernetes? If yes, we match existing. If no, who sets up the container service?
DNS and domain: What URL will this live at (e.g. coaching.franklincovey.com)? Who controls DNS? Process and lead time for CNAME/A record?

Secrets management: AWS Secrets Manager / Azure Key Vault / GCP Secret Manager / env vars? We need to store 5-6 secrets (DATABASE_URL, HMAC_SECRET, email API key, NEXTAUTH_SECRET, CRON_SECRET, SENTRY_DSN).
TLS certificates: Who handles them? ACM (AWS) / Let's Encrypt / corporate CA? Is there an existing load balancer or API gateway we sit behind?
Outbound network restrictions: App makes outbound HTTPS calls to Resend (email) and Sentry (monitoring). Are any blocked by egress firewall?
Email sending provider: Resend (requires DPA) or client's existing infra (AWS SES / SendGrid)? Which is approved?
column11: Related to Q1 (DPA question).

column3: Email 'From' address and domain: e.g. coaching@franklincovey.com. Need DNS access for SPF/DKIM records, or client team sets those up.

Coach identity provider: Are coaches on FranklinCovey SSO (Okta / Azure AD / Google Workspace)? Could use for coach/admin login instead of magic links. If independent contractors, magic links are correct.
column11: Affects auth architecture.

column3: Backup and DR expectations: Specific RPO/RTO requirements? Cross-region replication needed?
Logging and monitoring stack: Datadog / Splunk / other? We default to pino JSON logs + Sentry. Should we integrate with their existing stack?
Data retention policy: How long should engagement/session data be kept after completion? Government requirement for data retention or deletion timelines?
column11: Government contract may have specific requirements.

column3: Load balancer: Existing ALB/NLB/Cloud LB or do we provision one? Rate limiting (for auth endpoints) is configured at this layer.

Participant auth model: Does 'receive a link, enter an approved email' mean: (A) unique link per participant + email verification gate, or (B) generic link + email identifies them? Recommendation: Option A is more secure.
column11: Option B requires rate-limiting the email lookup.

column3: Chemistry interview scope: Consolidated review recommends deferring entirely. If client disagrees, it adds 2 states, 4+ transitions, and causes 5/8 CRITICAL edge cases. Does both coach AND participant need to confirm?
column11: Deferred per technical review. Need client buy-in.

column3: Nudge cadence: Are proposed thresholds acceptable? (7 days participant reminder, 14 days coach nudge, 21 days ops escalation, 7 day cooldown)
Session logging dropdown options: Are the proposed SESSION_TOPICS and SESSION_OUTCOMES lists complete? Client should review before dev.
column11: See config.ts for current lists.

column3: Coach profile content: What fields? (bio, photo, specialties, credentials?)
Email branding: FranklinCovey branded? Government agency co-branded?
Data retention: How long is data retained after engagement completion?
column11: Overlaps with Q17.

column3: Coach booking tools: What booking tools do coaches currently use? (Calendly / Acuity / Teams Bookings / etc.) We will link to their existing booking page via meetingBookingUrl.
column11: Needed to populate meetingBookingUrl field for each coach.

column3: Client strategic pivot: Vision expanded from one-off coach-matcher to MVP for a platform handling ALL FranklinCovey engagements. Client sees industry disruption and wants to transform their delivery model.
column8: Greg Smith (VP) directive: 'build the overall portal architecture for ALL of FranklinCovey's coaching engagements, then fill in this immediate use case first.' CIL Brief confirms: 150+ coaches worldwide, 250+ active engagements, 65+ client orgs. $6.9M USPS deal in pipeline where data reporting is key criterion.
column11: CIL Brief provides full business context. Platform vision confirmed at VP level.

column3: What other engagement types does FranklinCovey run beyond 1:1 coaching? (Group coaching, workshops, assessments, multi-day programs?)
column8: CIL Brief confirms: Group Coaching exists (Kari tracks several group engagements with separate reporting/metrics). Individual coaching and group coaching are currently NOT integrated.
column11: Kari's Lovable prototype has separate Group Coaching section.

column3: How many programs/contracts does FranklinCovey typically run concurrently? What scale should the platform eventually support?
column8: CIL Brief: 250+ active engagements across 65+ client organizations. This immediate engagement = 400 participants across 4 programs.
column11: Much larger scale than original PRD assumed (5-10 coaches).

column3: Does FranklinCovey envision other organizations (clients/partners) having their own admin portals on this platform, or is it always FranklinCovey-operated?
column11: CIL Brief mentions 'sponsor teams (coachee, leader, HR/talent partner)' which implies client org visibility but not self-service admin.

column3: Coach filtering: Is filtering by location / credential / skills / language participant-facing (they choose filters) or system-side matching (algorithm uses these attributes to pick 3 coaches)?
column11: CIL Brief says 'Filter by location, credential, skills, language.' PRD has shuffle+take 3. These are different approaches. Must resolve for March 2 Coach Selector.

column3: 20-min interview option for 5-session cohort: Is this a formal system feature (scheduling + tracking) or just 'book a short intro call on the coach's Calendly before committing'?
column11: PRD deferred chemistry interviews. CIL Brief brings them back for 5-session only. Complexity depends entirely on whether this is system-managed or just a Calendly link.

column3: Sponsor teams (coachee's manager + HR/talent partner): Is visibility into engagement progress MVP scope (March 16) or future?
column11: New concept not in PRD. Could be a simple 'CC on reports' or a full portal role.

column3: Which dashboard views are MVP? CIL Brief mentions 3: (1) Ops = all engagements, (2) Kari = per-coach status across clients, (3) Greg = portfolio-level quality metrics.
column11: PRD has single admin dashboard. Brief implies role-specific views.

column3: What are the 'top 20 objectives' for session topic dropdowns? CIL Brief mentions 'topic (from top 20 objectives list)' but doesn't list them.
column11: Needed before coach portal build. Our config.ts has a placeholder list.

column3: 'Printable reports' — does this mean browser print CSS or generated PDF download?
column11: PRD deferred print-friendly reports. Brief explicitly wants them.

column3: What 'methodologies' need to be configurable? Brief says 'change methodologies without needing us.'
column11: Implies admin-configurable methodology framework. Need to understand what this means concretely.

column3: Kari's Lovable prototype — which features should we match vs. reimagine? Review before Feb 18 discovery workshop.
column11: URL: https://lovable.dev/projects/e91f5432-4586-4210-a51d-f66e8b54378a. Features: Supervision workspace / Coaches page / Milestone report / Group Coaching / SurveyMonkey dashboard.

column3: NDA / IT procurement timeline — is this blocking access to FC infrastructure? When can we start deploying?
column11: CIL Brief: 'NDA/IT procurement required.' Questions sent to Blaine (CTO).

column3: March 9 week (Amit at Mayo Clinic) — what's the continuity plan? Who covers development during this gap?
column11: Between March 2 (Coach Selector live) and March 16 (full portal). Critical timing.

column3: Participant auth model: Does 'receive a link, enter an approved email' mean: (A) unique link per participant + email verification gate, or (B) generic link + email identifies them? Recommendation: Option A is more secure.
column8: CIL Brief says: 'Participant receives email link, enters approved email, sees 3 available coaches' + 'No login required.' This is Option B (generic link + email lookup). Rate-limiting on email lookup is required.
column11: CIL Brief confirms Option B. Simplifies auth significantly — no HMAC tokens needed. Just email verification against approved list.
